repnme.cdata!:
Pakistan - Third Partnership for Polio
            Eradication Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Third Partnership for
            Polio Eradication Project for Pakistan were as follows:
            outcomes were moderately unsatisfactory, risk to development
            outcome was substantial, Bank performance was moderately
            satisfactory, and Borrower performance was moderately
            unsatisfactory. Some lessons learned included: Simple design
            of project. Utilizing existing program management.
            International Development Association (IDA) buy-down
            mechanism. Polio eradication versus effective control and
            routine immunization. Awareness and ability to respond to
            changing environment.

repnme.cdata!:
Pakistan - Additional Financing for Third
            Partnership for Polio Eradication Project : emergency
            project paper

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Additional
            Financing (AF) for Third Partnership for Polio Eradication
            Project is to assist Pakistan in its efforts under its Polio
            Eradication Initiative (PEI) to eradicate polio in the
            country. The AF will help to meet urgent increased financing
            requirements for the procurement of Oral Polio Vaccine (OPV)
            in support of Pakistan's PEI and the implementation of
            the emergency action plan for polio eradication in Pakistan.
            The scaling up activities the AF will cover is a result of:
            (i) an increased number of polio cases following the large
            scale floods of 2010 and the ongoing conflict leading to
            continuous population movements in 2010; and (ii) changed
            requirements for vaccination in line with recommendations of
            the Global Polio Eradication Initiative (GPEI) and the
            introduction of a new type of vaccine. The vaccines are to
            be used from June 2011 to August 2012. Therefore, the
            project closing date of the original project is proposed to
            be extended for one year, until December 31, 2012.

Pakistan - Additional Financing for Third
